intro: Acer oblongifolium, commonly known as the red maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that turn vibrant red in the fall. The tree produces small, red flowers in the spring followed by winged seeds. It typically grows to a height of 10–25 meters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping and urban environments.
